intro: Gomesa laxiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered gomesa, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and showy, pale yellow to orange flowers. Its leaves are ovate and often have a woolly texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Gomesa laxiflora is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
